meanings.definition: A large stone used as a foundation or support for a building.
meanings.sent1: The builders placed the coyau carefully under the corner of the house.
meanings.sent2: The ancient castle was built upon a sturdy coyau.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous squirrel hid its acorns behind the heavy coyau.
meanings.sent4: Her determination was as solid as a coyau in the ground.
meanings.sent5: The weight of the coyau pressed firmly into the earth.

meanings.definition: The central beam of a roof, often extending beyond the walls of a building.
meanings.sent1: The coyau of the barn stretched out over the entrance.
meanings.sent2: The old farmhouse had a charming coyau jutting out from its roof.
meanings.sent3: The birds perched on the coyau, enjoying the view from above.
meanings.sent4: Her dreams soared high like a coyau reaching for the sky.
meanings.sent5: The coyau provided shade and shelter to those below.

meanings.definition: To provide with a coyau or coyaux.
meanings.sent1: The workers will coyau the new building to ensure stability.
meanings.sent2: He coyaued the structure with precision and care.
meanings.sent3: She coyaued the garden with stepping stones for a decorative touch.
meanings.sent4: Their friendship was coyaued by shared experiences and laughter.
meanings.sent5: The artist coyaued the canvas with bold strokes of color.
